Class SpaceGameClient

java.lang.Object
  SpaceGameClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpaceGUIInterface
public class SpaceGameClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements SpaceGUIInterface

Author:
bachmaer Driver class for a simple networked space game. Opponents try to destroy each other by ramming. Head on collisions destroy both ships. Ships move and turn through GUI mouse clicks. All friendly and alien ships are displayed on a 2D interface.

Constructor Summary
SpaceGameClient()
          Creates all components needed to start a space game.
 
Method Summary

          Causes sector.ownShip to turn and sends an update message for the heading change.

Constructor Detail

SpaceGameClient

public SpaceGameClient()
Creates all components needed to start a space game. Creates Sector canvas, GUI interface, a Sender object for sending update messages, a Receiver object for receiving messages.

Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException

fireTorpedo

public void fireTorpedo()
Causes sector.ownShip to turn and sends an update message for the heading change.

Specified by:
fireTorpedo in interface SpaceGUIInterface

moveFoward

public void moveFoward()
Causes sector.ownShip to move forward and sends an update message for the position change. If there is an obstacle in front of the ship it will not move forward and a message is not sent.

Specified by:
moveFoward in interface SpaceGUIInterface

moveBackward

public void moveBackward()
Causes sector.ownShip to move forward and sends an update message for the position change. If there is an obstacle in front of the ship it will not move forward and a message is not sent.

Specified by:
moveBackward in interface SpaceGUIInterface

join

public void join()
Creates a new sector.ownShip if one does not exist. Sends a join message for the new ship.

Specified by:
join in interface SpaceGUIInterface

stop

public void stop()
Perform clean-up for application shut down

Specified by:
stop in interface SpaceGUIInterface

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
